name: Corinthia Hotel Prague

reviews.title: Hot Rooms and Inconvenient Location
reviews.text: This hotel is clean and modern. However, with only slighly elevated temperatures outside, the rooms were uncomfortably hot even with the one window open - which opens only minimally. We were told that the engineers "were working on the problem", but nothing changed in the two days we were there. The lobby was nicely air-conditioned, so one can doubt that the problem could be remedied. I would recommend avoiding this hotel in spring and fall "shoulder" seasons. The hotel is near the efficient Prague metro subway system, but requires a trip of two stops, a train change, and another two stops to get to the Old Town Square. Getting to the Prague Castle is an even more complex odyssey. There is nothing of cultural or culinary interest near the hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent City Break
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights here at the end of Feb 09,booked via Hotels.Com 3 nights B&B for the price of 2 .Two hiundred and twenty pounds Business room 2 adults.A great touch was the complimentary bowl of fruit and free use of the Business Lounge(Free Tea Coffee and Internet use.The room 827 was of a good standard.Check in and breakfast supburb.My only complaint was the Hotel was empty and lacked atmosphere,the Hotel restaurants were expensive in comparison to city prices.Location was good although it was a real effort to go back into the city to eat after a day site seeing.The city tour booked via the Hotel was a rip off,not helped by the guide not turning up and the replacement involved translation in 5 languages!!.Stick to genuine Czech cuisine when eating out its much better value and cheaper than Western fare.The Beer is good and the beer museum mut not be missed.Bought an adult 3 day rover pass from the airport 600Czech Kroner for 2 adults and could be used on Bus,Tram and Metro.The Taxi back from the Hotel to the airport was overprioced at 850CZ but necessary due to early Sunday flight

reviews.title: We had a great time
reviews.text: We stayed in an Executive Room on the Executive floor and it was great. We had a nice room with a comfortable bed and the room was well maintained. The Executive Floor Lounge was a nice place to hang out and have a snack or drink. There was a nice breakfast served each morning in the lounge and a nice "Happy Hour: each evening. The service was great and everyone was helpful. The Metro is very close and it is only a few stops and you are in the Old Town of Prague. It is all very easy to figure out. We walked to Vysrod or the high palace and had a nice dinner at RIO. No complaints at all during our stay!

reviews.title: nice stay
reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel for city break. no real complaints. good variety of food for breakfast. the hotel gym had good equipment. it took about 15 minutes to get into the city centre by metro. at nightime we would catch a cab back to the hotel as the metro stopped running - this was cheap. the staff were also helpful.

reviews.title: Very nice business trip
reviews.text: I stayed here as a guest of the Czech Government so it is difficult to comment on value but some of the rates I have seen advertised would be very reasonable for the standard of accommodation. It was very much what one would expect of a good international hotel with some specifically Czech touches, especially in the food. This was notably good and it was clear they were trying to show off the best that the country had to offer and succeeded with the buffet dinner they laid on for us in the conferencing rooms. Breakfast was also excellent.

reviews.title: Disappointments - small niggling problems - I will not be back
reviews.text: Small, but - for me anyway - significant problems pull this hotel down in my review. When I go to a hotel on a business trip, in addition to the usual services I need wifi and I want to start my day in the gym. I usually pick my hotels based on reviews and most of the time I am not disappointed. This time I was:

reviews.title: Perfect location for Congress centre
reviews.text: - there is no wifi in the room, just wired connection - I cannot connect my iphone

reviews.title: Nice hotel,but out of the centre.
reviews.text: - the wired connection vastly overpriced - you can select the speed from 1 -8 Mbit and you pay by the speed, but even for a 2 Mbit you pay the equivalent of a whopping $28 (!) and you get an inferior connection you can just about work with...

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: - the gym opens 6:30 - I usually up much earlier to get myself ready for the day, and get done my 40 min run on the tredmill - in most hotels you can get to the fitness center with your room key - apparently not here.

reviews.title: What's the matter with them??
reviews.text: - There is no iron in the room - this is not always included but the description of this hotel specifically stated that, anyway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 day break and i would just like to say that this hotel was spot on. The rooms were very spacious, quiet and clean. The staff were very polite and helpfull. The pool and leisure facilities are spot on with great views. I was not keen on the seperate sauna/steam room as it was boring without my other half but not a complaint at all. The hotel has great views of the city and is so close to get to from the station outside the hotel.
reviews.title: No complaints whatsoever !!!

likes.disliked: — Not having a communal sauna, but not a complaint

reviews.text: I was slightly apprehensive having read earlier reviews but the whole stay from walking in to leaving was as good a service as i have had anywhere.
reviews.title: had a great stay

likes.liked: — easy to get to city centre
likes.disliked: — the shower was very weak but its not a major concern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cant comment on the food as we only ate in the city but if you want a high quality base just outside the city this is the one.
reviews.title: Shiney hotel!

reviews.text: i came to this hotel with alot of poor reviews from this site on my mind.
reviews.title: Restaurant Needs Improvement

likes.liked: — The room was big and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — I did not like the attitude of the waitress in the restaurant.

reviews.text: within a few minutes of my stay these had dissappeared.
reviews.title: Big let down, not recommended

reviews.text: I stayed in Corinthia towers with my mum and two sisters in Dec 08 and had a great time. Check in was efficient and we were informed that our rooms had been upgraded!
reviews.title: Had a great time, hence why going back next month

likes.liked: — Lovely surroundings, convenient location and great views
likes.disliked: — Some of the staff were quite brash and expected tips.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms were twin's, both very clean and no problems at all. We found the metro station outside to be very useful as this is how we travelled around the city.
reviews.title: Huge dissapointment!

reviews.text: The breakfast was also great, was a lot of choice - everyday we found something new to try and as it was a buffet breakfast we ate a great deal so that it lasted for most of the day!
reviews.title: 5 Star ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined in the hotel restaurants which, if a little pricey, were nice and had good service.
reviews.title: Corinthia, efficient 5 star!

reviews.text: I have booked a suprise trip to Prague for my boyfriend for valentines weekend next month and I am pleased that I managed to book this hotel as quite a few sites were showing it as fully booked. After reading some of these reviews where people have had bad experiences I just hope Im lucky again with the room. I upgraded to a panoramic room so I hope it should be around the same standard? Any ideas on this?
reviews.title: Well managed hotel, OK stay

description: Corinthia Hotel Prague is a modern upscale business and leisure hotel with fantastic conference facilities with a wonderful top floor spa with a stunning view over the city of Prague. Less than five minutes away from Prague city centre, this Corinthia Hotel is a landmark in itself, standing atop one of Prague’s seven hills and offering outstanding views of the capital city. Access to the hotel is convenient and efficient by metro (only two stops to Wenceslas square), by car (own driveway connected to main highway Prague-Brno) and from the airport (25 minutes transfer). With three dedicated executive floors with an executive lounge, as well as a business lounge alongside the business rooms, Corinthia Hotel Prague is a perfect choice for corporate travellers,residential conferences and leisure travellers. An impeccable hotel service is complemented by superb amenities including a beauty parlour, cafe, lobby bar, an array of restaurants such as award-winning Rickshaw Restaurant, all-day dining The Grill restaurant with specialties from the char-coal grill, Café Praha offering a range of coffees and teas with scrumptious homemade cakes and freshly prepared snacks throughout the day and Blue Note Bar sets the jazzy mood later in the day with its aperitifs, perfect cocktails, fine cigars and unique collection of whiskies. For relaxation, the Apollo day Spa situated twenty-five floors above the city provides the ideal venue to relax. Swimming pool located on 26th floor with spectacular views, soothe your body, mind and spirit in a splendid oasis of calm with one of our massages or at sauna or steam room.
